subject: RE: [junit] Help needed in generating the test report
msgSnippet: The easiest way to get nice looking test reports is to run your tests from ant.  See question 6.6 in the JUnit FAQ:
messageBody:
The easiest way to get nice looking test reports
is to run your tests from ant. See question 6.6
in the JUnit FAQ:

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_6



> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of jain_gauri
> Sent: Monday, September 26, 2005 4:19 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Help needed in generating the test report
>
> Hi all....
>
> I m a new member of the grp and have recently started working
> on Junit.
> As on now i m able to run a simple test and suit. Now i need
> to generate a test report of the test that are being run.
> Currently i m getting a graphical report as i m using
> Eclipse. I know i need to make a xml file where i need to
> specify the dir and file for the report to be generated but
> exactly what is to done is still a mistry....Please help me
> on this its really urgent
>
> Gauri
